verses.verse: Have mercy<WH2603> upon me<WH430>, O God, according to your lovingkindness<WH2617>: according unto the multitude<WH7230> of your tender mercies<WH7356> blot out<WH4229> my transgressions<WH6588>.
Wash<WH3526> me throughly<WH7235> from my iniquity<WH5771>, and cleanse<WH2891> me from my sin<WH2403>.
For I acknowledge<WH3045> my transgressions<WH6588>: and my sin<WH2403> is ever before me<WH8548>.

Against you<WH2398>, you only, have I sinned, and done<WH6213> this evil<WH7451> in your sight<WH5869>: that you might be justified<WH6663> when you speak<WH1696>, and be clear<WH2135> when you judge<WH8199>.
Behold<WH2342>, I was shaped in iniquity<WH5771>; and in sin<WH2399> did my mother<WH517> conceive me<WH3179>.
Behold<WH2654>, you desire truth<WH571> in the inward parts<WH2910>: and in the hidden<WH5640> part you shall make me to know<WH3045> wisdom<WH2451>.
Purge<WH2398> me with hyssop<WH231>, and I shall be clean<WH2891>: wash<WH3526> me<WH3835>, and I shall be whiter than snow<WH7950>.
Make me to hear<WH8085> joy<WH8342> and gladness<WH8057>; that the bones<WH6106> which you have broken<WH1794> may rejoice<WH1523>.
Hide<WH5641> your face<WH6440> from my sins<WH2399>, and blot out<WH4229> all my iniquities<WH5771>.
Create<WH1254> in me a clean<WH2889> heart<WH3820>, O God<WH430>; and renew<WH2318> a right<WH3559> spirit<WH7307> inside me<WH7130>.
Cast me not away<WH7993> from your presence<WH6440>; and take<WH3947> not your holy<WH6944> spirit from me<WH7307>.
Restore<WH7725> unto me the joy<WH8342> of your salvation<WH3468>; and uphold<WH5564> me with your free<WH5081> spirit<WH7307>.
Then will I teach<WH3925> transgressors<WH6586> your ways<WH1870>; and sinners<WH2400> shall be converted unto you<WH7725>.
Deliver<WH5337> me from bloodguiltiness<WH1818>, O God<WH430>, you God<WH430> of my salvation<WH8668>: and my tongue<WH3956> shall sing aloud<WH7442> of your righteousness<WH6666>.
O Lord<WH136>, open<WH6605> you my lips<WH8193>; and my mouth<WH6310> shall show forth<WH5046> your praise<WH8416>.
For you desire<WH2654> not sacrifice<WH2077>; else would I give<WH5414> it<WH7521>: you delight not in burnt offering<WH5930>.
The sacrifices<WH2077> of God<WH430> are a broken<WH7665> spirit<WH7307>: a broken<WH7665> and a contrite<WH1794> heart<WH3820>, O God<WH430>, you will not despise<WH959>.
Do good<WH3190> in your good pleasure<WH7522> unto Zion<WH6726>: build<WH1129> you the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389>.

Then shall you be pleased<WH2654> with the sacrifices<WH2077> of righteousness<WH6664>, with burnt offering<WH5930> and whole<WH3632> burnt offering<WH5930>: then shall they offer<WH5927> bullocks<WH6499> upon your altar<WH4196>.
